boardgame.name: The Nullifier's Dream
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

After years of obsessive, curiosity-driven research, the elfmarked wizard Hecta Quisse was able to track down and claim a copy of the Nullifier’s Lexicon in Kel Azjer. Needing some privacy to effectively study the tome of Void magic though—and to stay ahead of the Northlander Ragnarok cult voidspeakers, who wouldn’t take their possession of the grimoire kindly—Hecta resettled in Dornig, securing a tower on the fringe of the Tomierran Forest: far enough away from the forest to stay out of notice of the church but close enough to tap into one of the more powerful ley lines for the mage’s various topics of research.

boardgame.name: Warlock Guide to the Planes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Listen, friend. Clearly you ain’t got no idea which way the Ever River flows, so let me clue you in, right? The world you came from—its moons and stars and so forth—that’s just one plane in an endless multiverse of planes. Each one its own sphere suspended in the branches of Yggdrasil, the World Tree, and touched by the twisting course of the Ever River.

The planes ain’t worlds like whatever benighted rock you stepped off. These are infinite realities, dimensions of cosmological existence. You’ve got your hells and heavens sure. But you’ve also got marketplace worlds and endless forests. You’ve got your unending battlefields and your gloaming fields of undeath. And surrounding ’em all is the Yawning Void where elder things sleep.

I know not why you came, but out here, there’s enough adventure, treasure, mystery, and peril to satisfy any band of would-be heroes.

So open your eyes to a larger cosmos, but watch your step, friend. For among the planes, delights and dangers await in equal measure.

boardgame.name: 100 Oddities for a Dungeon
100 Oddities pour un Donjon
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to “100 Oddities for a Dungeon,” the sixteenth entry in Skirmisher Publishing’s popular and bestselling line of system-free sourcebooks designed to make any areas or encounters taking place in them more fun and interesting! This supplement is dedicated to dungeons in the classic sense of places used to confine and punish people, including prisons, jails, oubliettes, and torture chambers;

boardgame.name: Beneath the Witchwillow
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lilli Amberthaud and Harper Elincourt, the heirs of two rival families in a minor duchy of Dornig, fell in love. Because of the bad blood between their families, they kept their affair secret until Lilli was betrothed to another.

A few days after the announcement, Lilli went missing. After an extensive search, the affair came to light, and Harper was accused of killing her out of anger or jealousy. Though no body was ever found and he staunchly maintained his innocence, Harper was imprisoned for the crime and remains in jail.

However, the PCs have discovered something that may shed new light on Lilli’s disappearance: a children’s book called Beneath the Witchwillow… with a terrible secret hidden within.

boardgame.name: The Glowing Ossuary
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cloudwall Mountains hide a tomb unlike any other—the forgotten, once-dwarven halls of the dead known as the Glowing Ossuary.

Branching out like stony roots from a seemingly bottomless shaft, this tomb runs deep into the earth below, so deep that it’s rumored to be endless, possibly extending into the Empire of the Ghouls and beyond. A century ago, however, its entrance was buried in an avalanche caused by foolhardy adventurers. With an entrance sealed beneath so much rubble and snow, the dwarves left the tomb as a silent memorial to those interred within.

Recent rumors claim an enthralled legion of skeletal laborers, incessantly digging deeper, toiling under the dark gaze of a cruel master: Naz’Vaza, a death knight of unimaginable malignancy and cruel resourcefulness.

boardgame.name: Bearfolk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This zine’s topics include:


“Bearfolk Baronies and Wandering Tribes” by Sarah Madsen
“Bengta the Bear Maiden” by Celeste Conowitch
“Bearfolk Honey Items” by Celeste Conowitch
“Bearfolk Magic ” by Mike Welham

boardgame.name: Paris: Metal Coins
boardgame.description: 35 Metal Coins for Paris.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Paris

boardgame.name: C4ISR System
boardgame.description:
Hex-and-counter, Red v. Blue, brigade/battalion-level wargame of modern land tactical actions, with the emphasis on title's Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Knowledge, Information, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance. Even the basic game requires players to place and move Information Nodes so that their other units can be given orders.

Advanced rules allow the sides to advance beyond the WW II=level paradigm of the basic game, e.g., replacing hierarchical communications trees with true networks that have redundant paths.

Game is in Chines; professionally done eight-page English translation, and two pages of charts, provided.

boardgame.name: Catpitals
boardgame.description:
Catpitals is a geography-themed card game that engages memory skills, knowledge of capitals of the world, and strategy used as you learn your opponent’s strengths and weaknesses. The goal of the game is to win the most cards. Gameplay is directed by one of 6 different cats that appear on the cards. Three cats provide players the opportunity to see the country map and its capital on their opponents’ cards, which players will be challenged to successfully remember later in play. The other 3 cats direct various play that allow players to steal or win cards by either correctly naming the capital for a given country, or by carefully selecting an opponent who will not likely know or remember the correct answer.

Each of the 60 cards has a unique colorful map depicting several countries with one or more capitals identified. One round of the game takes approximately 20 minutes. The game moves fast enough that several rounds can be played, which has the benefit of introducing more countries and capitals into play. A more challenging game can be played by requiring all capitals on a given card to be correctly named in order to win the card.

The game can be enjoyed by people of varied ages and knowledge as everyone gets an opportunity to win cards based on their own competencies and strategy. Ultimately though, as one learns more capitals of the world a distinct advantage will develop, especially if one plays repeatedly.

boardgame.name: Burning Dragon
boardgame.description:
From the Atlas Games website

Burning Dragon at a Glance
A Feng Shui adventure that lets you kick butt across the Gobi Desert!
Features a new adventure structure for huge events that makes them easy to run for new and experienced GMs alike.
Includes a new template for pulse-pounding Feng Shui fights, making them easier to run than ever!
The World of Burning Dragon
Burning Dragon is a counterculture phenomenon held annually in the Gobi Desert. A raw celebration of creative talent and Mongolian culture to “forge the dragon” — creating a temporary city dedicated to art, age-old athletic competitions, and extravagant performances.

This year, however, Burning Dragon has been suborned by Damien Wu — festival organizer, Triad big shot, and secret Eater of the Lotus sorcerer. When the dragon effigy burns during the closing ceremonies, Wu will use a blood sacrifice to harness the attendees’ souls and reawaken the ancient feng shui site that smolders beneath the festival grounds!

Explore the myriad events of the vibrant, chaotic festival!

Reveal Wu’s perfidy and punish his treacherous Triads by kicking ass across the Gobi Desert!

Save the girl! … no, wait, never mind. She already saved herself. Help the girl!

Sabotage the evil Lotus ritual, turning it to your own advantage! Then summon the spirits of ancient heroes in a firework-festooned finale!

boardgame.name: Where the Machines Wait
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Where the Machines Wait is a 5e mega-adventure for characters of roughly 5th level. It can be played as a series of short ventures into the Grave of the Machines, easily placed between other adventures in your campaign. Its deeper plotline can be introduced at any time—or you can ignore it and explore the ruin. Where the Machines Wait includes new creatures, new items, and a new playable species of mechanical, construct-like characters: the surk.

Numenera players can also delve into the Grave of the Machines: Where the Machines Wait includes complete conversion notes for Numenera and the Cypher System.

boardgame.name: A.G.E.
A.G.E.: Advanced Galactic Empire
Advanced Galactic Empire
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Similar to Elite you travel around as a space trader, fight in battles and get in contact with other characters.

This is the follow up of Coktel Vision's Galactic Empire.

boardgame.name: Emmanuelle
Emmanuelle: A Game of Eroticism
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Licensed from Emmanuelle Arsan's erotic novel based on her own fantasies.

In the game you play as a man who tries to attract Emmanuelle, while fending off rivalling men, face down smugglers, visit bars and much more.

boardgame.name: Galactic Empire [1990]
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Roam space as and conquer the universe. Though the plot is linear you can roam freely.

boardgame.name: HIT !
No Mercy
boardgame.description:
HIT ! is a press-your-luck game in which you draw cards to get points — but you don't want to draw too often because then you might lose all your gains!

In more detail, the 90-card deck contains eleven cards each numbered 1-5 and seven cards each numbered 6-10. On a turn, you flip over a card from the deck and place it in front of you, stealing (if you wish) all the cards of the same number that are in front of other players. You can stop after each draw, or you can draw another card. If you draw a number that you already have lying in front of you — and you have at least three cards in front of you — then you discard all cards in front of you from the game.

At the start of your turn, if you have cards in front of you, place them face down in a personal score pile, then start your turn. When the draw pile is exhausted, all players place all the cards they have in front of themselves in their score piles, then they tally the numbers on all their scored cards. Whoever has the highest sum wins.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Svavelvinter: skuggspelet
boardgame.description:
In 2013 came the role-playing game "Svavelvinter" where "skuggspelet" is included and can be played as a separate board game.
In Trakoria, powerful and mysterious forces are constantly moving in the shadows, forces whose scheming affects the unaware inhabitants of the archipelago don´t know anything about. To recreate this feeling "Skuggspelet" is used.
A player has won when a shadow power has achieved dominance in a number of key spheres. On a board with 15 spheres, for example, five can be named key spheres and dominance in three of them is required for victory.

—user summary

boardgame.name: QBasic Gorillas
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Ballistic artillery game where the cannons are gorillas on top of skyscrapers throwing bananas.

Included in MS-DOS 5.

boardgame.name: Tour 91
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Action cycling game where the player choose between one of eight riders and complete a four stage cycling race. First stage is a time race, second is a plane stage, third in the mountains and the fourth is a sprint.

boardgame.name: Eco-Saurus
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Educational game about Environmental Conservation Official (E.C.O.) and his alien friend M-Kar trying to conserve energy and collect recyclable materials from the inhabitants of Eco Island, rebuild M-Kar's space ship and provide enough power to fuel it so he can get home.

boardgame.name: Set del Master
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
Bundle for L'Ultima Bomba RPG, including:
DM Screen,
Scenario,
Sourcebook.

boardgame.name: Arena
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
Bundle for L'Ultima Torcia RPG, including:
Scenario,
Sourcebook.

boardgame.name: Le Peuple Loup: Mon Aventure
Sekret Wilczej Gromady: Moja Opowieść
WolfWalkers: My Story
boardgame.description:
In WolfWalkers: My Story, two players compete to create a grid using cards from a shared deck, with those cards bearing illustrations from the Wolfwalkers movie.

Each turn, you take one of the six available double-sided cards and place it in your grid, taking either one of the two Objective cards that indicate how you can score points or one of the four Story cards that will help you fulfill these objectives. Objectives come in three types: shapes that reward a specific arrangement of cards, arrows that reward the placement of certain icons in the same row or column as the objective, and equations that reward the same number of certain icons anywhere in your 5x5 grid. Each card you place after the first must be adjacent to another card. After both players have completed their grid, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

The game includes an expansion that provides more options for players and more interaction, with Permanent cards that change gameplay in general and Opportunity cards that allow you a special once-per-game ability. For a small change in gameplay, add one Permanent card of your choice; for more advanced play, add one Permanent and three Opportunity cards at random. With 15 permanent cards and 25 opportunities cards, no two games will be alike.

With a second copy of WolfWalkers: My Story, you can play the game with up to four players.

boardgame.name: Hungry Monster
boardgame.description:
Game made with different materials and textures to develop manual dexterity. It can be played in two different ways:
Prepare a pizza with the 4 ingredients depending on what appears on the wheel.
Feed the monster being the first to run out of ingredients.
Educational game to learn different foods.

—user summary

boardgame.name: На Вуте да му е зле
boardgame.description:
Всички играчи стават съседи в панелен блок. Целта е да изгониш всички съседи и да завладееш панелката.

Съседът, който опази нервната си система до край, ще бъде „Господар на панелката”. За целта в началото на играта всеки съсед получава хапчета за глава.

След всеки удар по нервната система, който не си успял да предотвратиш, трябва да „изпиеш” хапче, с което да успокоиш нервите си.

Ако съсед остане без хапчета, нервната му система не издържа и той незабавно напуска блока и играта.

Накрая оцелява само един или нито един.

Динамична игра на стратегия, наблюдателност, хумор и късмет… всичко, от което се нуждаеш, за да оцелееш между четирите стени.

—description from publisher

Using Google Translator from the Ukrainian Cyrillic to the English:
All players become neighbors in a panel block. The goal is to drive out all the neighbors and conquer the panel.

The neighbor who protects his nervous system to the end will be "Master of the panel". For this purpose, at the beginning of the game, each neighbor receives head pills.

After every stroke on the nervous system, which you failed to prevent, you should "drink" a pill to calm your nerves.

If a neighbor runs out of pills, his nervous system fails and he immediately leaves the block and the game.

In the end, only one or none survives.

Dynamic game of strategy, observation, humor and luck… everything you need to survive between the four walls.

boardgame.name: Adventure Climb VR
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Adventure Climb VR is a climbing simulator for VR. Climb a perilous mountain face, cross a rope bridge over a waterfall, discover Egyptian ruins, and zipline to the finish line.

boardgame.name: Nemesis Perspective
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Nemesis Perspective is a 1-vs-1 asymmetric VR fighting game. Take the role of an angered genie intent on destroying a would-be hero who dared disturb your rest. The VR player controls the genie's hands and can attack the hero and buildings. The hero is controlled by AI, or a second player can control the hero with a gamepad.

boardgame.name: The Isle of Cats: Explore & Draw – Kickstarter Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
A set of promotional cards originally given out during the 2021 Kickstarter.

This pack of cards adds "mixed" cards to the game, a new type of card that contain both cats and treasures.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Roll- or Flip-and-Write Versions of Non-Writing Games
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Isle of Cats: Explore & Draw

boardgame.name: Urban Flow
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb from their website:

Urban Flow is a game about the subtle beauty of city streets filled with cars moving in perfect harmony. But such order does not happen all by itself - the city needs YOU to control the traffic lights and to make sure everything goes smoothly. That means no crashes, no jams. Everything will run perfectly - as long as you stay focused!

Switch lights, keep the city safe! Urban Flow is aimed for fans of action puzzles, good single player content, local multiplayer games and urban music!

boardgame.name: Quest for the Antidote: King's Decoy Promo Card
boardgame.description: This promo card was for the limited-edition first print run of Quest for the Antidote. The King’s Decoy meddling card, has a special code in the lower right-hand corner of the card to distinguish it.

boardgame.name: Cruel Seas: Drache – helicopter carrier
boardgame.description:
The Drache started as a seaplane tender built in Hamburg for the Royal Yugoslavian Navy in 1928. She was converted into a minelayer in 1937. Captured by the Germans in 1941, the Kriegsmarine renamed her the Drache (dragon) and converted her back to a Flugzeugbergungsschiff – an aircraft rescue ship. Drache underwent a refit back to being a minelayer in the spring or summer of 1942 and was moved to the Aegean. She was re-equipped with two 105 mm (4.1") guns, five 37 mm and six 20 mm cannons. A rear platform was added with space for 240 mines on four rails. The Kriegsmarine renamed her Schiff, but she is better known as Drache so the name is retained here. The large flat rear deck made her suitable to test the concept of a helicopter carrier – the world’s first – using a Flettner Fl 282 Kolibri (Hummingbird) as a spotter aircraft.

The Kolibri was the world’s first naval helicopter. It was unarmed but the Kriegsmarine intended to use it for submarine spotting. It could also be used for artillery spotting and reconnaissance.

Pack contains 1 resin & metal vessel and game cards. The full rules for fielding Drache (and helicopter) in Cruel Seas can be found in the Close Quarters supplement

boardgame.name: Cruel Seas: Sturmboot 42
boardgame.description:
This was a larger version of the original river-crossing sturmboot with an internal engine capable of transporting a platoon rather than a single section. They were also used in enclosed seas such as the Mediterranean and Baltic.

Contains 4 metal boats and game cards.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 18 Hex Hex
boardgame.description:
A solitaire railway building game consisting of 18 turns, in each of which you fill two hexes with passenger rails and stations, goods rails and factories, plus forests and spoil heaps.

Each turn you roll 7 dice, 4 blue and 3 red. The blue dice are used for passenger lines and stations; the red dice are used for goods lines and factories. You may also use dice to purchase modifiers for use in future turns, including extra dice.

You will gain points mainly for connected stations and factories, but also for a long passenger route and a large group of connected factories. However, you lose points for being forced to place spoil heaps.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cruel Seas: Elco Barge-Busters
boardgame.description:
In the summer of 1943, the primary mission of the PT boats was to interdict Japanese supply lines by shooting up the enemy landing craft (referred to as barges by American reports) being used to transport supplies. It was at this point that Pacific PT boats were upgraded to have 40 mm/37 mm cannon on the bow and stern. Three old Elco 77’ boats were converted into barge-busters by stripping off the torpedoes and adding extra armour, radar and more MGs.

Contains 2 resin and metal vessels and game cards.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cruel Seas: LCS(L) – Fairmile H
boardgame.description:
The LCI(S) was a Fairmile H wooden design using the same prefabrication techniques used in their Dog Boats. It was designed as a cheap-to-make raider transport. Around 40 were built in 1942. Some were converted to LCS(L) support gunboats.

Contains 2 resin and metal vessels with ship cards.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cruel Seas: Small Sampans
boardgame.description:
A player who fields ‘tiny boats’ in Cruel Seas will find their use most entertaining and will undoubtedly make his opposing commander very worried indeed! The great strength of such vessels is their size but this makes them equally vulnerable to all manner of incoming fire.

As the Japanese merchant marine became ever more depleted the humble Sampan became the main fallback for the Imperial Japanese war machine, delivering vital cargoes of men and equipment.
Small sampans must be taken in squadrons of three – meaning only one dice is used for all three.

Contains 6 metal boats and game cards.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kharkov, May 1942: The Last Disaster
boardgame.description:
May 1942 saw the first major, considered offensive by the Red Army in the war against Germany. Expectations were high, with four Soviet armies aiming to encircle the German Sixth Army and to recapture the fourth largest city in the Soviet Union. Those expectations were dashed within a fortnight by the German Army’s ability to absorb the offensive and launch a counteroffensive of its own which, in its turn, encircled two Soviet armies.

Kharkov, May 1942 – The Last Disaster is a miniature wargames campaign system, designed for two to four players, covering these events. It is designed for games in which a stand represents a platoon or in which the main unit of manoeuvre is the battalion. Suitable rules would include Spearhead, Blitzkrieg Commander, Command Decision: TOB, A Fistful of Tows, Rapid Fire Reloaded and others, including those which wargamers may have written themselves.

The system generates fifty or so hours of gaming spread over ten to fifteen individual battles which are fought over six to fifteen daily campaign turns. The number of turns is flexible and determined by whether either player can encircle the enemy’s forces. Progress in the campaign is measured along campaign tracks representing the two major axes of attack with a number of battlefield ‘spaces’. Each turn players decide whether to attack or not and then which parts of their total forces they commit to any ensuing battle. Battles will generally be around a brigade or regiment of four to eight battalions on each side. The results of each on table battle determine the speed of advance on the main campaign map.

The book includes

a brief history of the campaign
background information useful in adapting the system to different sets of rules and suggestions for additional optional rules
a comprehensive set of Appendices covering
the Tables of Organisation and Equipment to platoon level for all divisions and regiments involved (around forty regimental sized formations)
a record of the At Start forces and reinforcements
a chart to track the position and composition of forces on each attack axis
19 colour terrain squares of the battlefields (based on nearly 600 square miles of original 1930s maps) which can be used to generate 570 six feet by four feet tabletops
a Campaign Quick Reference Sheet
a colour A4 Campaign Map
a set of suggestions to convert the system to Bob Cordery’s Portable Wargame rules




100 A4 pages with 20+ colour illustrations.


– Description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Fistful of TOWs 3: Miniature Wargame Rules – Modern Mechanized Warfare 1915-2015
FiveCore Brigade Commander: Brigade Level Warfare in the 20th Century
Rapid Fire Reloaded: Fast Play Wargaming Rules for World War Two Land Battles

boardgame.name: Flames of War: White Death – Mid War Finnish Forces 1942-43
boardgame.description:
The Finnish Army had become famous across the world for its epic defence against the 1939 Soviet invasion of the Winter War. In 1941 they joined the Germans in the war against the Soviet Union. The bitter lessons of the Winter War had been well learned. These were further reinforced during the hard fighting of 1941 as they recaptured lost territory and pushed the Red Army back to their original frontiers. With hard-fighting infantry, skilled light infantry, and their newly formed armoured units, the Finnish Army are more than prepared to fight the Soviets to a standstill again.

White Death: Finnish Forces in Mid War contains:

Background on the Finnish Army and its divisions during Continuation War between 1942 and 1943
Instructions on how to build an Armoured Company, Light Infantry Company, and a Infantry Company
Painting and Basing guides
Basing guide
Command Cards and Unit Cards


–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: Waterloo 2025
boardgame.description:
Waterloo 2025 is a second game of the Third World War series, released by Taktyka i Strategia. It's straight continuation of the Ardennes 2024, a game set up in the hypothetical timeline, where modern Germany and Russia form an alliance to take a rule in Europe, where number of resources is decreasing drastically.

Waterloo 2025 starts with a massive riots in Belgium, goes on with a war between former allies and end with a last, massive offensive attempt of the Russian-German coalition. Game contains four scenarios that can be played one after another or stand alone.

Rules are mostly the same as Ardennes 2024, although some clarifications are made and some new rules introduced as well. All the units used in the game are actually existing units of the modern European armies. Game uses battalion scale for the western units and brigade scale for Russian units.

As a wargame, Waterloo 2025 uses typical hex and counter mechanics with I go-you go system and light rules (13 pages or rules and 3 pages of tables.

boardgame.name: Commandments Card Game
boardgame.description:
A family gin-rummy style game where players take turns drawing and discarding cards while trying to get a set of the ten commandments, but watch out for rebellions and the greatest commandment cards that can make and break sets of commandments quickly.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Svengali
boardgame.description:
Part of the Child's Play card game series, Svengali, the psychic's game is a card game where players try to use their psychic abilities to transmit information about their cards to the other players who must either receive a mental image, or simply deduce the clues. Cards feature two shapes of different sizes in two different colors and player get points for correctly guessing the four attributes of a card one at a time, but are penalized by drawing more cards for wrong guesses.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Jolly Roger Arithmetic
boardgame.description:
Actually four games in one, Jolly Roger is part of the Child's Play card game series.

Cards show various pirate themed pictures on the back sides and jolly roger flags featuring math problems on the other. Families can enjoy snap style games, where players take turns playing cards one at a time until the last two cards match (or any in the pile) depending on which side you choose to play with. In the snap game modes, the player who collects the most cards wins.

Jolly Roger Arithmetic also features the new Jolly Roger game where players take turns playing cards one at a time trying to be the last pirate with cards but a ransom card valued 1 - 4 causes the next player to lose 1 - 4 extra cards unless they can pass along another ransom (which can be played by either side). In the Jolly Roger plunder modes, the last player to still hold any cards wins.

--user summary

boardgame.name: Smash Up: Cessare e Desistere & A Che Pensavamo?
boardgame.description:
Smash Up: Cease and Desist can be played on its own as a two-player game or combined with other Smash Up titles to allow for up to four players to compete for control of bases at the same time. Cease and Desist includes four factions — Astroknights, Changerbots, Star Roamers, and Ignobles — with 22 cards for each faction. To play, you shuffle together any two factions, whether from this set or any other Smash Up title, then start playing.

Smash Up: What Were We Thinking? returns to the wild randomness of the early days of Smash Up. By combining this expansion with your Smash Up sets, will you take Zombie Rock Stars against Explorer Dinosaurs? What about Time Travelling Grannies versus Teddy Bear Vampires? It’s all possible now! All your dreams can finally come true!
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Smash Up: What Were We Thinking?

boardgame.name: NOVA - Quick Start
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

NOVA is an action packed tabletop RPG coming to Kickstarter on June 8th. When the sun exploded, we built exosuits to explore the ruins of old earth. These machines, called Sparks, are our final hope of ever having a new dawn.

You are those Sparks. Get ready to suit up.

boardgame.name: Of the Gods: A Game of Dueling Deities
boardgame.description:
The gods are always looking for a chance to squabble, and nothing provides a better excuse than human war. As the armies face off, the gods are looking on with interest. Whose army is the worthiest of glory? Whose army will they descend from the heavens to join in battle? And most importantly, whose army will reign victorious and attract the favor of the gods?

Goal: In this 2-player hand management duel-game, earn the most Victory Points by winning Battles and assembling the greatest Pantheon, gathering more copies of each god than your opponent.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Railroad Ink Challenge: Epic Board
Railroad Ink Challenge: Giant Board
boardgame.description:
Dive into adventure with the Epic boards! With more spaces to explore and mountains to bypass, get ready to build the biggest networks ever! To play with the Epic boards, you need 6 basic Route dice, so two copies of the game are needed.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Railroad Ink: Expansions Box
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Railroad Ink Challenge: Lush Green Edition
Railroad Ink Challenge: Shining Yellow Edition

boardgame.name: Alpha Zulu
boardgame.description: Players simultaneously yell words where the first letter spells other words to win the game.

boardgame.name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Tabletop Wargaming: 3rd Edition Rules
boardgame.description:
Heavy Gear Blitz! is a tabletop miniatures wargame with over 20 years of heritage and success.

The colony world of Terra Nova continues to be in a state of constant conflict. Massive polar nations, invaders from Earth and even armed gangs have turned its arid landscape into a never-ending battlefield. Old grudges and fragile alliances set the stage for complete chaos while the Northern, Southern, Peace River and NuCoal Factions fight countless wars in the name of power, profit, revenge or mere survival.

Having failed to conquer Terra Nova once before, Earth has added her subjugated colony worlds to a new Colonial Expedition Force (CEF) invasion force of GRELS, FLAILs, and Hovertanks. Ships blacken the sky, unleashing unending waves of would-be conquerors onto Terra Nova’s war-torn surface. Even Utopia’s newest technological marvels of war have joined the CEF to claim a piece of the planet. Will the factions of Terra Nova unite as they did in the first invasion? Will that be enough this time? Or will Earth grind another planet under her iron heel?

The War for Terra Nova has only just begun... Gear Up and join the battle!

With the Heavy Gear Blitz 3rd Edition Rules you can:

Enjoy a fast paced, alternating activation game that leaves no player waiting as every action can be reacted to. Choose to play a casual skirmish game with as little as four models or an intense competitive game with 20 or more models.
Build a force from 10 different Factions and 36 Sub-Factions drawn from multiple worlds of the Heavy Gear Universe.
Use a “combined arms” approach to future warfare that includes Gears, Striders, Combat Mounts, Hovertanks, Tanks, Infantry, VTOLs, and Aircraft.
Select from a diverse array of weapons, electronic warfare tools, and many other options to destroy your opponent.
Wage war using a highly flexible system with customization options for commanders, forces, or even individual models as veterans and duelists.


3rd Edition Rules also includes introduction to the Heavy Gear Universe, objective generation, weapons recognition, reference sheets, and game tokens sheet. Plus model lists for the new plastic miniatures included in the Northern, Southern, Peace River, NuCoal, CEF, Caprice, & Utopia Army Boxes.

Also included are pdfs of the tokens sheet, force record sheet, Terra Nova maps, badlands buildings and stoneheads terrain flat sheets. And our collection of Heavy Gear Blitz paper terrain that you can print on cardboard/cover stock, then cut-out and glue together for some quick tabletop terrain.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Two Player Starter Box
boardgame.description:
The Heavy Gear Blitz! Two Player Starter Box provides everything two players need to get started:

the New Northern Plastic Miniatures Army,
New Southern Plastic Miniatures Army, and
Full Color Quick Start Rulebook (2nd edition).


Scale: 1/144

–Description from the publisher

boardgame.name: I'm Right You're Wrong
boardgame.description:
I'm Right You're Wrong is a fun-first game that promotes mental wellness, themed around petty arguments. In fact, it was inspired by a real life office spat.

Outwit and outlast your opponent(s), by holding onto your hand, and not breaking a rule.

Take turns, drawing a card and playing one from your hand. Each card is empowered with consequences. Some cards reduce your hand, some cards restrict your options. The twist is… attacking opponents screws you over, not them. It’s the only card game where playing your least worst option is your best. Play is similar to other casual games (hand management, elimination, take-that). No actual role-play or arguing involved.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: I'm Right You're Wrong: Shots Fired
I'm Right, You're Wrong: Game-Breaker Expansion Pack

boardgame.name: Potato Inferno!: Demonotized Spudtuber
boardgame.description:
This is an expansion for Potato Inferno, including 25 new cards and 6 spud-tuber tokens!

Join the spud-tubers in the ups and downs of potato themed content!

Will you be demonetized? or dominate the Internet with the power of potatoes!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Size Does Matter
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Size Does Matter is an adventure designed for 4-6 Level 2 characters for use with the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: Clockwork Catastrophe
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Clockwork Catastrophe is A literal trainwreck of an adventure for 3-6 level 1 characters for use with the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: Coffee Drake
boardgame.description: The coffee drake is a new monster for the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: Big Trouble Adventure 06 - Trouble's End?
boardgame.description:
From storefront:
This is it, the final battle for Lilliput! War rages between the animals of Mammoth Park and the nefarious Ostrumites. The heroes' mission is to infiltrate the town's elementary school, find the Star Stones, and defeat Alistair. Can they pull of their mission and beat the Ostrumites once and for all in Lilliput? Will they finally be restored to their normal size?

Trouble's End? is an 11 encounter adventure that includes 8 new monsters, 9 new maps, new items, and more. It features multiple paths, multiple endings, and story hooks to continue Big Trouble beyond the adventure modules.

Double-sized maps included for most encounters. Also includes printer friendly version.

Requires: Big Trouble Settings Guide and Rules

boardgame.name: Big Trouble: Invasive Species
boardgame.description:
From storefront:
Invasive Species is a supplement for the Big Trouble RPG series. It includes cards for 6 new heroes, 10 new monsters and 6 NPC characters from of the Big Trouble Lilliput trilogy. Also included are micro-bios of the 6 NPCs.

All cards are in both color and black & white.

Included cards are:

Hero Cards - Mangaka, Game Designer, Gymnast, Jiujiteiro, Debator, and Mathlete.
NPC Cards - Chiyomi (crow), Dragon (cat), Slick (turtle), Cheesebeard (rat), Felix (human), and Alistair (human).
Monster Cards - Earwig, Ladybug, Praying Mantis, Murder Hornet, Vesper Bat, Tufted Puffin, Pigeon, Venus Flytrap, Weaponized Drone, and Robo Vaccuum Cleaner.
Requires: Big Trouble Settings Guide and Rules

boardgame.name: BattleFish
boardgame.description:
The way I see it, if I knew that one day I would either get sautéed in butter, rolled into a sushi roll, or fried up and served with a side of chips, I would want to do something about it too.

In Battle Fish you are in an epic capture the flag battle for control over the seas. Build your army of fish-controlled battle robots, and protect your base at all costs. Win by conquering your enemy before they conquer you.

BattleFish is a family friendly, strategic capture the flag card game. It is easy to learn, with simple rules, easy setup, quick playtime, replay-ability, and a difficulty level that varies with the group you are playing with (making it so that all ages can play.)

You can play in groups of 2-6 and you can play as teams or as individuals. The game starts from the moment you begin setting up the game. You use your cards to strengthen your base and protect your flag or to attack your enemies and steal their flags. The winner is the last player (or team) with their flag still in play.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Th!nk Cross
Think Cross

TH!NK CROSS is a world full of logi puzzles and secrets, and offers a very high degree of fun!!

- 150 levels
- Bonus and secret levels
- 31 various graphic sets
- wonderful animations
- password system
- continous degree of difficulty
- include elements requiring skill
- Digi Sounds

boardgame.name: Wingspan: Speckled Eggs
boardgame.description: These 100 speckled eggs (10 egg tokens in 10 different color combinations) showcase some of the beautiful eggs created by birds of the world. They are are the same size, texture, and material as other Wingspan eggs.

boardgame.name: Ramses
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Freeware strategy game set in 1551 BC where you can travel around to trade various goods in the Mediterranean, buy more ships (from around 1551 AD) and build awesome monuments.

boardgame.name: Catch ‘Em [1992]
boardgame.description:
Back of box
All hell has broken loose at the Zoo! Wlile the gate-keeper Jeff was busy reading the latest edition of his favourite game magazine the monkeys plotted their escape . . .
Now havoc reigns in the local area, with gorillas and orangutans joining in the fun!
Help Jeff restore peace in this humorous platform-puzzle game with over 35 levels, 250KB of animations and 10 great tunes, you have fun trying!

boardgame.name: Summoner Wars (Second Edition): Starter Set
Summoner Wars: Starter Set
Summoner Wars: Tundra Orcs vs Phoenix Elves
서머너 워즈: 스타터 세트

Standalone Summoner Wars Starter Set containing the Phoenix Elves and the Tundra Orcs.

This Second Edition Starter Set provides two complete faction decks not found in the Second Edition Master Set, along with all the materials needed to play games of Summoner Wars.

Bonus! Mercenary promo cards Khan Queso and Blacksaber.

boardgame.name: Fort Apache
boardgame.description:
User summary

As a captain at Fort Apache you command up to 44 units and use these to fight against Indians, mexicans, bandits and thieves. If you do well, you will get promoted.

The game is turn based.

boardgame.name: Nomad [1993]
Project Nomad
boardgame.description:
Back of box
Welcome NOMAD, to a unique universe of exploration, warfare, diplomacy and mystery. Change strategies as quickly as you mood in deciding wether to fight, trade or simply let the storyline take you on an incredible journey. It's possible to solve this "stellar mystery" without firing a single shot. Featuring brilliantly rendered 3-D graphics, cinematic views, digitalized voices, and an engaging sense of humor, your mission is entertaining in every dimension. Interact with over 11 Alien races, represented by over 150 fully animated Aliens, each with their own language, personality, physical characteristics, and artificial intelligence.
BE WARNED: these Aliens will never forget how they'sve been treated by a player, and will take that into account in future encounters! With a storyline equivalent to a 900 page novel, NOMAD is an intense, milti-layered adventure that adapts to every level, style and characteristic of each player, right down to naming your own starship! NOMAD is everything you'd ever want in an interactive adventure.

boardgame.name: Mystery at the Museums
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The second in the Adventures with Edison series and sponsored by Smithsonian Institution where you are doing midnight treasure hunts at the museums.

boardgame.name: Quizine
boardgame.description: Quizine is a food trivia game played in teams (recommended) or individually. You move along a track, and have to answer questions or fulfill tasks printed on cards, depending on the kind of field you landed on. Tasks include drawing a food or cooking related item, and explaining an item without mentioning it. Correct answers or correct guesses from your teammates move your pawn forward, and the goal is to reach the central field first.

boardgame.name: Pick 1
boardgame.description:
Pick 1 is a card game in which you try to get rid of your hand cards as early as possible. Cards either show a number and one of three colors, or a penalty in one of the colors.
In each turn, one card from the stack is flipped open. Each player simultaneously picks a matching card from their hand (matching means: same color or same number/penalty). All chosen cards are then revealed. The player who played the highest card in the same number as the open card gets all the penalties, which are either to draw cards from the stack or to steal a card from another player.
When one player gets rid of all their cards, everyone gets points for the cards still left in their hand (number cards count their value, penalty cards count 10 points). When a player hits 100 points, whoever has least points, wins.

boardgame.name: Curse of the Ancient Emperor
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Curse of the Ancient Emperor is a classic dungeon-delve with an Aztec flavour designed for 3-6 level 10 characters for use with the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: Slaying the Marsh King
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Slaying the Marsh King is an adventure designed for 3-6 level 6 characters for use with the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: Playmobil: Dragon Fight
boardgame.description:
The box contains a total of 32 cards, namely:

24 warrior cards
4 joker cards (one for each symbol/strength)
4 rule cards


In Playmobil Dragon Fight players play cards to win tricks. Unlike other trump card games, this game uses four different suits, from which the player can choose to play their card for. Every card has four symbols/strengths, these are: Tactic, Attack, Defense and Range.

At the start of the game, the warrior cards are shuffled and all are dealt among the players as equally as possible. Every player gets one joker card, the remaining joker cards are removed from the game. After receiving their cards, players put them -face down- in front of them.

The starting player takes the top card from his deck and pick one of the four symbols to play. They call out both the symbol and the point value. Then the other players take the top card of their decks and call out the point value for the chosen symbol and show their cards to prove their claims. The player with the highest point value in the chosen strength wins the trick and places all cards -face down- at the bottom of their stack. The game continues until a single player owns all the cards.

Jokers can be used to win a trick, they always have the highest point value. But they can only be played at beginning of the turn or if the corresponding symbol has been called out.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Corrupted Monsters
boardgame.description: A collection of vile monsters and a short adventure for use with the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: Soul Devourer
boardgame.description:
From the description:

While the adventurers are calmly moving throughout town, they get approached by a particularly weird-looking, young man. He looks incredibly rich, dressed in expansive robes and plenty of golden jewelry matching the attire. His beautiful blue eyes and long blond hair would make for an incredibly beautiful face, and yet he looks very sleepless and stressed. He asks them if they are adventurers and mentions that he is DEEPLY in need of help.

Someone had the smart idea of selling their soul for power, and no way of getting it back. You'll travel through earth to reach the gates of hell, before fighting the hordes of hell, and facing vicious foes that won't hesitate to try and rip your soul apart. Will you save the innocent ? Will you die heroically ? Or will you side with hell?

Soul Devourer is a descent into hell adventure designed for 3-6 level 18 characters for use with the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: The Altar of Blood
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Engage in a fight to the death against the First Plague ! This adventure is full of well… blood, blood monster, traps, and a fight against the Antichrist that is the 1st Plague.

You are renowned adventurers, mighty heroes of the Realm, and the Realm needs your help. The 10 plagues have been unleashed upon the lands, and who else but you to take the fight against the first one.

The Altar of Blood is an adventure designed for 4-6 level 17 characters for use with the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: Bundesliga Manager Hattrick
Football Limited
Football Ltd.
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Manage a team in the German soccer leagues and manage all aspects including tactics, transfers, sponsors, stadium and more.

The English version Football Limited has English clubs instead of German.
boardgame.videogameversion: European/German DOS CD-ROM Classic Line re-release

boardgame.name: What Lurks Below
boardgame.description:
From the description:

What Lurks Below is an adventure full of darkness, spiders, traps and one angry Queen designed for 4-6 level 16 characters for use with the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: A Grand Performance
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A Grand Performance is a free level 10 adventure for 3-5 players full of intrigue, cursed beings, blood trails and vampiric romance.

boardgame.name: Love is Lost
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Love is Lost is a free level 4 adventure for 3-6 players full of budding romance, interesting NPCs, oceanic wonders and one epic boss battle against Cupidon.

boardgame.name: Ocean of Greed
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Ocean of Greed is a Free DnD 5e, level 8 One-Shot for 3–6 players full of treasure, blood, pirates, and one angry Treasure Golem.

boardgame.name: Perilous Expedition
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Perilous Expedition is a free level 4 adventure for 3-6 players full of harpies, brilliant npcs and did I mention Flying Ships?

On practically every town board and on the lips of every town crier is only one name: Almendrud. The heroes heard this nobleman is in search of adventurers to aid him in a new expedition. They are told to meet his associate in a tall tower known as the Archeologicus Post. Who would be brave (or foolish) enough to delve in this adventure ? Put on your hat, and ready your whip, your inner Indi Jones is calling !

boardgame.name: Ultimate NFL Coaches Club Football
boardgame.description:
User Summary

American football manager game where you take charge of an NFL team from the 1994 season - or you can create your own team and players.

boardgame.name: Komockarspelet
boardgame.description:
Children's games where it is important to have luck and a good memory. Help the farmer clean Rosa's paddock. The one who fills his wheelbarrow with the most cow dung wins! Rosa loves food and it is important to remember where your favorite food is. Without food - no cow dung in the wheelbarrow.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Pea Shootin' Pete
Spit Wad Willy
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Game by Raoul Said. Similar to Buster Bros. where you control Willy or Pete depending of the version.

The two versions are similar but with minor differences.

boardgame.name: saKodo
boardgame.description:
Fill your backpack with memories, adventures and stories gleaned from around the world and be the first to reach the airport with a full bag!
Each card is a pretext to discover a distant culture; the change of scenery is guaranteed!
To move, you don't need a dice: you get caught hitchhiking by other players, or you pay according to the distance traveled.

boardgame.name: ハリネズミは時計回りに (Hedgehog go around clockwise)
boardgame.description:
ハリネズミは時計回りに (Hedgehog go around clockwise) is a puzzle-like board game from Japan that mixes elements of the traditional game Mancala and drafting dice. The game has polyhedral dice in different colours (d6, d10, d20). Players are alchemistic hedgehogs who go around collecting dice on their spines, to deliver them to their storerooms and laboratories. Each hedgehog has their own circuit, moving dice around in a way similar to mancala games.

The dice are then combined to make more and more creatures, which earn the hedgehogs gold coins and victory points. By combining different sets of d6 dice, the hedgehog gains certain d10 dice. Then, combining those in sets earns d20 dice, which lead to the most rewarding creatures.

At the end of the game, the hedgehog with the most points is the winner.

The publisher says:
A sensational new game woven by drafting dice around a mancala, mixing them to complete formulas and build up victory points!

You are a hedgehog alchemist. Every day you deliver magical materials to the Alchemist Guild for a rich old age.
Your small hands are not enough, so you can carry the materials around by sticking them into the needles on your back. Collect snails, frogs, and small dragon materials and deliver them to the guild to earn gold coins.

After delivery, turn around again and return the materials one by one to the storage. Mixing the colors of the dice is the key to acquiring new materials (dice). To get an orange frog (decahedron), you need red and yellow snails (hexahedron) and so on! The guild will give you gold coins when you deliver the materials you have acquired. After delivery, store the rest of the material (dice) in the storage.
user summary

boardgame.name: Sendas
boardgame.description:
Sendas is a two player, abstract strategy board game.
The action takes place in a 9x9 grid board where players control 6 pieces each (differentiated by light and dark colors) starting from mirrored positions on opposite sides.
Players take turns moving and/or rotating one of their pieces in an attempt to reach the opposite side of the board and be the first to take one piece out of it.
The pieces are square blocks with a white line on top called “Senda” (“Path” in English) that comes in three shapes: a straight line, an elbow, a T or a + shape.
The only rule is that all pieces of the same color must stay connected to each other by the senda at all times. You can not make a move if it disconnects your pieces or your opponent's from the rest of the same color.
The sendas of both players can also be connected, creating one long senda that allows for pieces of both colors to get mixed in an intricate pattern.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Arcane Bakery Clash: Boss Bake-Off 3
boardgame.description:
A 3-Card Solo Expansion for Arcane Bakery Clash.

SETUP
Select one of the Contessa cards and place it face up. Place the other two cards face-down on either side, these are Contessa's moves. Place a coin at the top of Contessa's energy track.

Remove the Cheesequake and Omen Biscotti cards. Shuffle the remaining recipe cards.

HOW TO PLAY
Play using the standard game rules, adding the rules listed below:

At the start of Contessa's turn, move down each time track by 1. If a time track is at 0, take the action shown, then remove the coin. After removing time tracks, roll 1 die. If a die matches a move that doesn't have a coin on its time track, place one on the highest number of the track.

VICTORY
If Contessa has 0 energy and you still have any, you win. If you are ever reduced to 0 energy, you lose.

boardgame.name: Desolation
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Book of Lairs: Desolation is the sixth and penultimate book in the Book of Lairs series. This book consists of twelve lairs spread over two or more spreads, each with an accompanying map or two.

Each lair is mapped on to an area known as the Desolation, shown on the centre-spread of the book, but each lair is also themed (albeit loosely in some cases) on desolation, either by terrain, location, or situation. All lairs can be quite easily placed in an on-going campaign; jus drop them into a wilderness location and you're ready to go.

It reintroduces the Quiet Ones, a monster that first appeared in my first Book of Lairs, and uses monsters from the ACKS: Lairs & Encounters book, as well as core monsters from the core Adventurer, Conqueror, King System (ACKS) rulebook; this book uses that game as its ruleset, although it is easily compatible with other fantasy games.

boardgame.name: Charioteer
boardgame.description:
The ground trembles under a thousand angry hoofbeats. Wheels creak and reins pull as racers drive their horses forward in a panic.

You are a charioteer in the Circus Maximus, the greatest raceway in the ancient world.

A crescendo of noise builds with each lap. Chariots collide, whips crack. The crowd cheers for a surprising breakaway, rumbles as a favorite is damaged and falls behind. From the imperial box, the emperor laughs and shouts. Clouds of dust obscure the bright banners of the four factions.
Three hundred thousand fans are on their feet as you turn the final corner. This is not the finish they expected. You lead by a length, and only one rival remains; each throws the last of their energy into one final sprint. Many thousands are despondent, other thousands exultant and joyous. Their shouts become a roar, a long scream, as you surge for the finish line. Another hundred yards will make you a hero.


Charioteer is a new game from Sekigahara author Matt Calkins. Like Matt's previous games, Charioteer features simple rules, quick play, and novel mechanisms.

Charioteer is a strategic racing game that plays in one hour. Each player controls a chariot in the Circus Maximus of ancient Rome. There's lots of action, and it happens quickly, with simultaneous move selection.

Movement is determined by melding sets from a hand of cards. Every card does more than one thing, and it takes multiple matching cards to make a move. Choosing to use a card in one set means deciding not to use it in another. Timing when to make a critical move is as important as knowing what move to make.

Moves come in four colors, and each has a special advantage. Play a red move to attack your opponents, yellow to recover from disruption, black to turn a sharp corner, and green to sprint.

Each racer begins the game with different abilities, and they improve their skills as the race progresses, leading to big bonuses in their favorite types of moves. Show the emperor the kind of move he prefers, and a racer's skills will increase even faster.

Players deploy tokens to give their moves a special bonus. More tokens can be earned by impressing the crowd with large matching card plays. Players may choose to delay using their best sets until they're big enough to qualify for a fan token.

Some races will be violent and others calm, depending upon whether the players and emperor behave disruptively. Attacks cause damage, which reduces movement speed. Players who specialize in recovery moves may overcome damage quickly. Others may need to carefully deploy their shields on turns when violence is expected.

It's not always clear who's winning the race. Being in front of the pack may not be as important as developing a critical skill, collecting powerful tokens, or keeping damage low. Whip icons allow those who have fallen behind to surge back into competition.

Charioteer is easy to learn. It can be played by bright kids as well as adults. Despite its accessibility, it is a game of skill.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dungeons
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is the seventh and final Book of Lairs, a series of lairs and maps that I started back in 2015.

Like most of my work, this has been supported by the kindness of my patrons, to whom I am forever grateful. Without their support this book would be languishing in the half-finished projects folder, waiting for its day to shine.

As with my previous books, this is a lair and map combination, spread across (mostly) a two-page spread, with each lair set in a dungeon. These are tiles that can be combined to create random dungeon complexes, by the roll of some dice.

boardgame.name: Persuasion
boardgame.description:
The Victorian courtship card game of deduction, catfishing, and conceding power.

Content Warning: This game presents marriage and independence as win/lose scenarios, and suggests relationships with unhealthy power dynamics.

While attending a party, you meet some suitors, full of potential wealth, standing, and passion. You’ve detailed your desires in your diary, and now you must discern who meets your needs by reading the trait cards they mail to you.

Your cards describe actions, but only the players you court will perform them. Each round, you share a card with a player, and they’ll choose which of your cards to leverage. When you find the one, send them your ring! They must reciprocate for you two to become engaged, so you must persuade them you’re compatible with their desires!

boardgame.name: Victoria 3
Victoria III
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Become a Truly Great PowerTend your nation as a garden, cutting off withering limbs and nurturing the sprouts of the future, in face of rapid scientific progress and social change.

The richest political simulation of the modern world returns.


Cultivate and trade dozens of raw materials and finished goods.
Dozens of governmental reforms for your population to demand.
In-depth information on your population as it changes and adapts through the decades.
Use your diplomatic prowess to impose your will on neighbors and rivals.


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Ruin D100
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The world fell and now you need to survive!

The Ruin is a dark and gritty Post Apocalyptic RPG using a D100 rule system, everything you need is inside this book.

The world of The Ruin was destroyed by an invasion from another dimension, creatures determined to terraform the Earth into a world they could live, but in order to save our planet, we almost destroyed it.

The Ruin is not a Zombie game but more a true apocalyptic experience, no mutants or even mutations just you against wild animals, gangs, raiders and disease, more akin to movies like the Book of Eli and The Road then The Walking Dead.

Within the game are:

7 classes to choose from
All rules for combat and vehicle combat
Gear and weapon tables
How to build a Settlement
4 City Guides
17 pages of threats
Encounter tables
Rules for surviving the wastes

So Grab your Scrap Gun and start exploring the wastes of The Ruin RPG.

boardgame.name: Pixel Legends
boardgame.description:
Use elemental spells to "save" the village!

Team up with fellow wizards to vanquish the sinister monsters that lurk in the dungeon, and save the nearby village. This is a noble, and honorable quest, and...oh, who are we kidding?

In reality, you're a greedy wizard who is all about fame and personal gain, and your fellow wizards are cut from the same cloth!

Even if the dungeon gets the best of you, fame lasts forever. To satisfy your thirst for a legacy, you must prevail over your opponents by learning the best spells and using that knowledge to outmaneuver and kill-steal in the dungeon, so you can gain the admiration of the townsfolk, fame across the realm, and acheive.... PIXEL GLORY

boardgame.name: What's So Cool About Magical Girls?
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a simple 2d6 plus modifiers with a consistent target number of 8 or higher. Built on the chassis of What's So Cool About Outer Space? which is itself based on Tunnel Goons, Sword & Backpack, and that really old classic sci-fi rpg about Beowulf.

Within you will find the rules needed to play, tables to help if you're stuck, some optional rules, and a bibliography and ludography.
boardgame.rpgseries: What Is So Cool About Jam
boardgame.rpg: What's So Cool About Magical Girls?

boardgame.name: Hike!
boardgame.description:
Hike! is a light and fast card-drafting racing game with huskies. Players take on the role of mushers (dog drivers) who assemble their husky sleds and race through the snowy wilderness.

The players carefully select the huskies for their abilities to move over treacherous terrain and place them in the sled according to their character. They gather the equipment and train their huskies. And then the race is on! The players rely on their huskies’ abilities and the preparations they've taken, a combination of luck and skill that would get them the first across the finish line.

Hike! is a command that mushers (dog drivers) use to start the team.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Hike!: Events and Traits Expansion Pack

boardgame.name: Army of the Dead: A Zombicide Game
boardgame.description:
Army of the Dead: A Zombicide Game is a standalone game in the Zombicide franchise based on the movie Army of the Dead (2021) directed by Zach Snyder.

In the tabletop adaptation, players take on the role of the well-equipped and well-trained mercenary company as they infiltrate into zombified Las Vegas and search out the bank vault. Each of these mercs has their own, unique skill set based on characters from the movie. As players make their way through the game’s many scenarios, they’ll be recreating scenes from the film, as well as venturing into many “off-screen” situations designed specifically for the game. But be careful, the zombies of Las Vegas aren’t going to just shamble slowly towards them. This will be a non-stop fight if the players expect to get away with the money… and their lives.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 人労 (Jinrou)
人勞(Jinrou)
boardgame.description:
人労 (Jinrou) is a werewolf style game from Japan, set in a business company. The title 人労 means Human Labour (essentially the HR dept), and is a homonym of 人狼 (Jinrou) which means werewolf.

The game is played over six rounds and the players have different roles in the company, each with various skills needed to complete projects. Each role also has secret goals, and players are trying to achieve their goals by the end of the game to win, or to avoid goals and not lose!

In a round, the team leader chooses three players to work on a project. These players (could include the leader) submit two skill cards in secret, which are shuffled and played up. If the six cards show certain combinations, then a player might win or lose on the spot.

But if players can work out what role a person has, they can determine their goals, and play skill cards to make them fail, or make themselves win. By disguising their own roles, players have more chances to achieve their objectives and avoid being eliminated.

For example, the CEO does not want to be in four projects, because they will die of over work. The Lazybones wants the CEO to die, or wants the projects to fail so they don't have to work. The Secretary wants to find romance with anybody but the Lazybones. The Temps want to be in four projects so they get hired permanently, and so on. And everyone wants to fall in love with the Secretary.

Lazybones will win the game if the projects fail to complete, or if the diligent workers fail to take their vacations or miss out on romancing the Secretary.

The various goals and possible outcomes means winning the game depends on concealing roles and identifying others'.

The publisher says:

This is a game about hiding your identity. You are an employee of a company and you are involved in a secret project, hiding your true identity from each other. You have to achieve your goals while taking care of your paycheck and your love life!

Each player has a hand of cards that matches his or her abilities, and they all work together to move a single piece through the backgammon of event cards (i.e. projects) towards the goal.
There is also a lot of fun to be had in the squares where the pieces stop. Squatting, talking in gyaru-speak and other events will help you to win the game.

正体隠匿系のゲームです。あなたはとある企業の会社員として、互いの正体を隠したまま秘密プロジェクトに参加します。
有給消化、社内恋愛をこなしながら自分の目的を達成しましょう！
プレイヤーは各自能力に合わせた手札を持ちます。全員で協力して一つの駒をすごろく状にならんだイベントカード（＝プロジェクト）の上をゴールを目指して進めますが、中にはプロジェクト達成などどうでもいい人も・・・？
駒がとまったマス目にもお楽しみがいっぱい。スクワットやギャル語で会話などイベントをこなしながら、勝利を目指します。
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Team Oniyanma (チームおにやんま)

boardgame.name: Winterhaven Woods
boardgame.description:
Winterhaven Woods is a 1-6 player strategic card drafting and set collection game that takes place over 3 rounds and typically takes 15-20 min. It features light player interaction each round, and customizable levels of "take that" mechanics.

In Winterhaven Woods, players are preparing the animals of the forest to endure the long winter months. They do so by planting trees to create woods, populating their woods with creatures, and using their predators to hunt creatures left exposed in player's meadows. Players may also use steal cards to swipe cards from their opponent's woods & meadow, however utilizing too many incurs a penalty.

Each round, players will draft cards, then plant & populate their woods, building it up over the course of the game. Player's may also collect predators in their meadow to hunt with, taking advantage of creatures not able to be populated by other players.

After three rounds players total their scores, bonuses and penalties, and the player with the most points wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Instant Universe
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Finally! A star system generator that captures the vastness and variety of space, time, and technology.

boardgame.name: Refighting History: Volume 9 – The Seven Years War: More Small Actions in the Western Theatre
boardgame.description:
Looking at the Seven Years War, military historians tend to concentrate on the big battles. However, the day to day campaign activity of the combatants included reconnaissance, raids, probing actions, resupply and a host of other minor operations that frequently lead to small skirmishes.

What I want to do in this volume of Refighting History is to take some of these actions, however small, and however sketchy in terms of accounts, and turn them into wargames. They will also demonstrate that you do not need large armies to wargame the Seven Years War.
The Western Theatre accounts provide details of the day to day activity by both armies. Coupled with this, the great variety of light and irregular troops provides a whole range of different unit.

The result is this volume with small historical actions refought on the wargame table. There is also a significant amount of background on the units involved coupled with art work to illustrate the uniforms.

—description from designer

The scenarios are compatible with many rulesets
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sharp Practice: Wargame Rules for Large Skirmishes in the Era of Black Powder, 1700 to 1865

boardgame.name: Verana Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A clan of goblins have taken possession of an abandoned keep and sent a request for aid in return for their fealty. Will you offer your support against the shadowy creatures that hunt them?

boardgame.name: Azdrulma the Dreadful
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Something evil lurks in the crags above the town of Yalwon, making the people nervous. People have come back scared, mad, or not at all. Little do they know, a merciless beholder has taken residence within the rock and plots against them using her favorite new minion: a shadow dragon.

Unaware of what they are up against as they delve deep into the lair, are your adventurers up for the task?

An adventure designed for characters level 16-18, this module includes a map of the lair's layout.

boardgame.name: Trip to Town
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Written for a party of 1st level characters “Trip to Town” is a starter adventure to get the party together. It avoids the usual tavern meet-up and throws the disparate party members together on the road and then brings them together with an unnatural storm and…murder.

This adventure provides encounters suitable for diverse play styles. For those who enjoy role-playing, there are opportunities to form meaningful bonds with NPCs ranging from a jolly merchant to an orcish Fistbreaker. For those who favor roll-playing, there are plenty of opportunities for battle. The primary setting for the adventure is wilderness, though there is also a dungeon.

While the encounters in this adventure are linked into a coherent story, you can cannibalize this adventure for standalone encounters that can be run on their own.

boardgame.name: Keys to Riverdale High
boardgame.description:
Keys to Riverdale High is door flipping madness. Race your favourite character from the Archie comics down the halls of Riverdale High, where behind every door awaits a surprise. Just don’t let Mr. Weatherbee catch you, or it’s straight to the detention room. Gameplay is based on our best-selling tile game Keys To The Castle.

Keys to Riverdale High is a tile-based game of strategy and luck. Players must open and close doors (the tiles) to move along a path and be the first to cross to the other side.

Special cards are played to hacksaw through barred doors, use a skeleton key to unlock padlocked doors, throw a net on a player to stop them in their tracks or use secret passageways to maneuver your way to the other side.

The game is easy to learn and quick to play. With the tiles acting as the "board", there is a new outcome to each game every time the tiles and cards are shuffled.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Otherworld - Serpent's Dawn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dark Age: Otherworld – Serpent’s Dawn is a Solo Story Adventure. The premise for the story, along with the endgame of the protagonists, is included along with a brief description of the setting and circumstances. The descriptions are provided for the purpose of immersion only.

Forces are aligning against the Song Dynasty. Emperor Qinzong seeks a Champion. The people of Mancheng seek respite from a ghostly mist which haunts their Town. The Jin Empire seek to expand. A collision of such powerful elements requires Universal balance, and the manifestation of dormant Abilities in order to re-align the true course of destiny.

The Story is your own to tell, and your Character is yours to play.

boardgame.name: BuzzFeed 2000's Ultimate Trivia Game
boardgame.description:
So you think you know the 2000s?! Play over 400 pop culture trivia questions crammed with phat pictures, sweet trivia, and various game challenges. Relive the hot fashions, dope trends, sick movies, TV, & music! Divide into teams and face challenges like Double or Nothing, Head-To-Head Battles, Drawing, Clue Giving, Image Cards, and more! So, turn on your perfect away message and show everyone your mad 2000s skillz- because it’s never too soon to go back to the start of the new millennium.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Office: Assistant to the Regional Manager
boardgame.description:
Behind every great regional manager is a great assistant to the regional manager…” Now you can be that assistant! Take the next 20-40 minutes (depending on the number of players) to spread your influence throughout the office. Use your skills and sneaky smarts to best your opponents. Complete challenges, play raffles, place tokens and get points by taking control of locations in the office. Pull pranks when your opponents least expect. Use Schemes Cards against players to throw them off their strategy. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins. Climbing the corporate ladder can be brutal … or hilariously fun

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Lion King: Pumbaa Pass
boardgame.description:
Any Lion King fan will love this new, exciting, and fun family game featuring a very hungry Pumbaa! Pumbaa’s ready for some tasty grub—icky bugs to you and me! Players take turns feeding him the colorful critters until, well, he tosses his cookies, loses his lunch—you know, pukes. Then it’s time to scramble to find the bugs you need to win! To win be the first player to match all three bugs on three different leaf cards.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Lyrical Grammar Fuel, 1980s Harder Rock
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This zine focuses on 80s rock music—specifically hard rock, heavy metal, and punk rock—from Survivor or Journey to Megadeaath or Anthrax.

In this issue, we look at several things related to 1980s harder rock subgenres, which includes hard rock, heavy metal, and punk rock. First, we look into the definitions related to the music genre. We then look at a very brief timeline including a major predisessor, the rock 'n' roll genre of the 50s to mid 60s. A Lyrical Grammar Fuel tool provides some lyrical inspiration. Then we look at top songs for the most popular of the harder rock songs.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Christmas Ref
boardgame.description:
Is Christmas a genre? Or Holiday
Where is holiday media found on websites?
What type of random d1000 tool may help to create a Christmas story?
What is a brief timeline of highlights for Christmas songs, novels, movies & TV by decade or century?
And what Christmas songss, novels, movies & TV shows, and video games might serve as inspiration for fantasy gaming?


Those were a few of the questions and topics for this issue of SoRoPlay GamTools Zine.

This zine PDF brings together several rankings to create a ranking of average and frequency of ranking Christmas song, novel, movie & TV show, and video game ranking. It also has Hanukkah movies. It also awards medals to the most frequently cited works: gold, silver, and bronze.

A section at the beginning explores the fantasy definition and related words.

A brief history of the past decades and centuries of fantasy novels, movies & TV shows, and video games highlights major titles and works.
