Grammar Fuel: Genres is a book of random noun, verb, adjective, and adverb d100 tables each for 11 genres: fantasy, science fiction, horror, historical fiction, mystery, romance, superhero, mystery, romance, military & war, martial arts, western, and spy & espionage.

It is useful to help inspire the creation of fictional stories and games based on random keywords.

boardgame.name: Basic SoroPlay GamTools Basic Solo Fantasy RPG Gaming & Writing Tools
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Basic Solo Fantasy RPG Gaming & Writing Tools is a collection of tools, referred to as functions, that help you to play a solo game using polyhedral dice. It works by generating either answers to questions, step-by-step, or keyword prompts for interpretation.

It also includes an adventure seed engine is included in this version as a companion tool to be used with this book to create random story conflict, foe, theme, motivation, and twists.

boardgame.name: Essential SoroPlay GamTools
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Essential SoRoPlay GamTools is a collection of tools, referred to as functions, that help you to play a solo game using polyhedral dice. It works by generating either answers to questions, step-by-step, or keyword prompts for interpretation.

It also includes an adventure seed engine is included in this version as a companion tool to be used with this book to create random story conflict, foe, theme, motivation, and twists.

boardgame.name: Grad Rush
boardgame.description:
Set in Jen Eric High School, Grad Rush is a 2 player strategy board game that pits players to get their students to graduation as fast as possible. Players will play student cards to the board that advance forward every turn. Once your student and an enemy's student land on the same space they will perform a face-off, a rock-paper-scissors battle of athletes, misfits, and preps. The loser drops out and the winner continues on. Once a student gets to the opponent's side they will be added to the graduating class. Once players have 10 GPA in their graduating class they win. Players can use single use event cards to drastically alter the board to their advantage. There are also several game modes available to play including a cube draft and a 2 v 2 format with an extra copy of the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Milhouette (ミルエット)
boardgame.description:
Using three cards with silhouettes on them, in Milhouette (ミルエット) players discuss their predictions and make conclusions.

In more detail, the fortune-seeking player tells everyone what they want to know, e.g., "What does my future hold?" or "Will I find a divine pet?", then draws and reveals one card, with the fortune-telling players drawing two cards each. The fortune tellers then use their two cards and the seeker's one card to make their divinations. The seeker then nominates the player whose fortune telling touched them the most, with that fortune teller scoring a point.

boardgame.name: Mushroom Sorcerer
boardgame.description:
There hangs the twin moon
among the skies
When plenty pours her elements
Nighttime splendor it is!

Elementis, a land blessed with mystical elements and ancient magic, is guarded by The Great Sorcerer with his astonishing power throughout the years.
In every duo luna year, the Great Sorcerers’ Tournament is held at the Enchanted Forest where the winner will be awarded the secret to magic mastery as a successor in title.
The competition is dangerous and courage is no guarantee for survival – Attack or defence, spells will be casted and battles are inevitable ! Dazzling blast of magic between the GU towers will not cease until the last man stands and wins the seat as The Great Sorcerer !

There are 3 phases in each round:
1. Twilight
A sip of potion stimulates sorcerers’ sense of elements, giving them different powers for the rest of the night. Choose your potion wisely!

2. Night
During Night phase, sorcerers can perform 1 of the 4 actions:
a. Grow GU to gain element(s) and level up your sorcery and power.
Flame elements give your flame servants which destroy everything as their masters commanded.
Stone elements give your stone servants which protects your territory.
Water elements create drops, an essential substance for GUs’ growth, bringing the forest prosperity and abundance.
Thunder elements form mana, providing energy for sorcerers to cast spells.
Moon elements, the source of ancient magic. Sorcerers gain ancient knowledge by studying moon elements. Once a sorcerer controls a sufficient
amount of moon GUs and moon elements, one becomes the most powerful sorcerer and wins the game.
b. Ancient and powerful spell scrolls are scattered around the forest. Pick up and cast them wisely to create a chain of combo to destroy your opponents.
c. Waging war against other sorcerers is another way to gain influence. Let your opponent know who is the great sorcerer!
d. Summoning element to gain immediate assistance and resources.

3. Daybreak
Sun rises, sorcerers get rest in the day, recharging their magic, powers and prepare the works for the coming night.

Only the sorcerer with the most influence or moon elements win the game!

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Flip-Tiles: Urban Waterfront Expansion
boardgame.description:
Paraphrased from publisher's blurb:

24 double-sided color 6"×6" map tiles of piers, boardwalks, canals, and lighthouses.

Can be combined with other urban flip-tiles sets.

Wet, dry, and permanent markers erasable.

boardgame.name: Sparkless
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Sparkless is a 5E adventure set in a world of spirits and filled with exploration, conflict and magic. This adventure is designed for characters of 1st level and should provide enough content for two or three game sessions. In this supplement, you will find everything you need to take your players on a dangerous journey through mist-covered swamps to unearth forgotten knowledge and save a lost child.

boardgame.name: Coral Sea: Defending Australia
boardgame.description: Coral Sea: Defending Australia is a Campaign Study: a short book including a dozen scenarios (four operational scenarios, eight battle scenarios) in which the British Eastern Fleet defends Queensland from the Japanese. It requires Coral Sea and Eastern Fleet to play the scenarios.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Second World War at Sea: Coral Sea
Second World War at Sea: Eastern Fleet

boardgame.name: Street Fighter: The Miniatures Game – Stretch Goals Box
boardgame.description:
Twelve additional fighters & battle decks that were unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign.

Also includes the car bonus stage and Capcom Cup expansion.

The Car Bonus Stage:
Would this really be a Street Fighter game without a car destroying bonus stage?
This mode uses a a special game board made of 25 rectangular spaces depicting a destroyed car with 9 double sided car tiles placed over it. The mini game can be played solo (damage as much of the car as possible) or Versus other player (Each combatant race to damage as much of the car before their oponents).
The Car Bonus Stage add an additional movement option to help player compete with their oponents. If a character's figure enters a space occupied by an oposing figure, they may move the opposing figure a number of spaces equal to their remaining movement points.
Players attack the car by playing attack cards as a normal action. Once a damaged tile has 3 damage, it immediately flips over to its damaged side. Once the damaged side takes 3 more damage, it is removed from the board.
Players may not damage each other.

The Capcom Cup:
The Capcom cup is a 1 versus 1 tournament style game mode. Each player choose 3 characters. All paired players share their character cards with their oponent. They blindly remove one of the character, and return the cards to each other. Player then pick their fighter for the round out of the remaining ones.
Swiss round now begin: Use normal set up and 1 vs 1 rules. After a player is defeated, he may switch to his other fighter. The winner of the first round must stay with their current fighter until they lose. Once a player has won 2 rounds, they are the victor.
After a certain amount of swiss round depending of the amount of players at the start of the tournament, the Top cut rounds starts. These are played similar to Swiss round. Players are paired based on Swiss results: Top ranked players vs lowest ranked player. Player that lose the Top Cut rounds are eliminated until only one player is left.

boardgame.name: Viewpoint Revisioned
boardgame.description:
Viewpoint Revisioned is the first set in "Viewniverse", an episodic card game series that immerses players within the dimension-hopping adventures of the Blinkers, one-eyed beings from the planet Myclopia. Each episode takes the Blinkers to a new world in the Viewniverse — such as Triclopia, Spytopia, Menagerie and Paradise — with the objective of the game being to amass enough Viewpoints to transport the Blinkers home... or to their next adventure.

The number in the top-left-hand corner of each card indicates the number of Viewpoints the card is worth and the text at the bottom is the action to be performed. In turn, players simply draw a card from the Draw Pile and play a card from their hand into their Field of View.

At the end of their turn players count the Viewpoints of the cards in their Field of View, the first player to collect 100 or more Viewpoints wins. Viewpoint Revisioned gameplay is swift to dive into and deceptively strategic. Each card provides you with Viewpoints towards your objective as well as changing the game state in a variety of ways.

boardgame.name: The Batman
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to The Batman jumper, a little forgotten animated series based on one of the more popular characters of the DC universe, here you will have to deal with general crime, mad scientists, super-criminals and of course alien invasions. This one is a weirder one, mostly because a lot of the more well-known rogues got redesigns or general changes to how their abilities work, or hell start out as completely different people all together with different backgrounds then you are used to. You will arrive 3 days before the Joker makes himself known, and 3 years after the Batman started. Take 1000cp to make sure you survive.

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 17
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!

boardgame.name: Świątynia Chaosu
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Witajcie w świątyni Chaosu! Niegdyś stanowiąca dowód potęgi boga światła świątynia w sercu dzikiej krainy skrywa mroczny sekret. Przybytek został przejęty przez kultystów mrocznego księcia nieumarłych demona Orkusa. Wykorzystują oni katakumby pod świątynią do swych mrocznych rytuałów podczas, których przyzywane są demony a ciała ofiar powstają jako ich nieumarli słudzy. Jedynie grupa prawdziwych bohaterów może położyć kres temu świętokradztwu.

Świątynia chaosu to przygoda dla postaci 3 poziomu, w której badać będą podejrzaną świątynię oraz przemieżać rozległe katakumby znajdujące się pod nia.

boardgame.name: Hippogriff
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each issue of Creature Ecologies covers a different creature with pictures, educational information, and behavioral facts.

boardgame.name: Landfill Crash Site
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map, available in two formats - a PDF (print-and-play) "static" format, and an electronic (online) "animated" format.

Publisher's blurb:

This bundle features a Cyberpunk landfill with a crashed ship. Ideally for rescue missions or cargo retrieval.

boardgame.name: Gang Hideout
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map, available in two formats - a PDF (print-and-play) "static" format, and an electronic (online) "animated" format.

Publisher's blurb:

This bundle features a Cyberpunk Gang Hideout. The hideout includes TV, boxes, weapons cache, vehicles and more. Included is the main street the hideout is situated and also the front and back alley.

boardgame.name: Biz Alleyway
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map, available in two formats - a PDF (print-and-play) "static" format, and an electronic (online) "animated" format.

Publisher's blurb:

This bundle features a Cyberpunk long alleyway filled with the façade of various businesses. It includes 4 map sections. The maps have animated rain, lighting and smoke. The static files are also included in this bundle for use with Roll20 and similar.

boardgame.name: Le Plateau
boardgame.description:
Players try to connect at least three board sides with their team's counters. However, to place a counter on the board, they must win tricks whose cards correspond to the board's spaces—the more valuable the card, the better positioned the space.

Before play starts, players bid how many board sides they can connect with possible help from a partner or additional cards.

For the print-and-play version, you'll need a 78-card French Tarot deck, one of the boards provided with the rules, two sets of counters of contrasting colours, and a way to keep track of scores.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dark Age: Otherworld - Serpent's Kiss
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dark Age: Otherworld – Kiss is a Solo Story Adventure. The premise for the story, along with the endgame of the protagonists, is included along with a brief description of the setting and circumstances. The descriptions are provided for the purpose of immersion only.

The Jurchen Jin Empire have steadily advanced across Northern China. The Song Dynasty have retreated South, adding to the feeling among the citizens of Kaifeng that they have been abandoned. Only the Five Dragons resistance and the discredited former Royal Advisor Guo Jing remain in Kaifeng, offering resistance against the occupying forces.

The Story is your own to tell, and your Character is yours to play.

boardgame.name: Chaoses Limb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I first started working on Chaoses Limb because I wanted a ruleset to use for running old modules. There were plenty of retro clones out there, but I have a copy of Holmes basic and was familiar with the rules so I decided to start there. I already knew those rules were hard for new players to understand, but I figured the ruleset was small enough that it would be easy to edit, rewrite and clarify. I rearranged the rules to make things easier to find. I moved all the rules we typically ignored during play into an “Optional Rules” section. I further streamlined where I could and tried to eliminate most of the inconsistencies. Finally, I ended up adding a few of my own home rules or stealing rules I liked from other rulesets. Before I knew it, I had my own clone/hack.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Crawl Solo
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This solo roleplaying supplement enables playing Dungeon Crawl Classics without a Judge. The rules are split into three sections.

Part 1: This deals with solo playing and the basic yes-no question. These are handled with a DC style check using DC5, DC10, and DC15 as breakpoints and critical no/critical yes on a 1 & 20. These mechanics are used for asking about the world and for controlling other characters, such as when you have an entire party of 0 level characters to nurse through their first adventure.

Part 2: Two options are presented for open questions. The first is an icon-driven visual oracle. Sixteen d16 tables of icons are provided. You roll for two icons and use them to suggest an answer to questions, and even to plan your sandbox adventures. The second method uses random rolls to find a random page, paragraph, and sentence in any rule/setting books. Find two sentences and then pull out any words that suggest an answer to your question. Use as many books as you like, including any sword and sorcery fiction as sources of inspiration.

Part 3: How to play through modules and now to create a sandbox campaign where you do not know what is going to happen next.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: スシヅメ (SushiZume)
boardgame.description:
スシヅメ (SushiZume) is a tile placement game from Japan, making sushi for victory.

If you eat the wasabi, it's over! A quasi-abstract game where you fight with the sushi you make!

This is a game for two players. You place or move your sushi on a 4x4 board, and win if you surround your opponent's gyoku (omelette).

Stack the Tuna, Octopus and Shrimp tiles each on a Rice tile (including one with wasabi) to make Sushi pieces.

There are also Gyoku (omelette), Kappa (cucumber roll) and a Tekka (tuna roll) tiles, so each player has a total of 6 pieces of sushi to play with.

If you are in trouble, you can eat your opponent's sushi only once during the game. The eaten sushi will be removed from the game.

However, if it has wasabi in it, the player who eats it loses the game immediately.

サビを食べたら即終了！ 握った寿司で戦う準アブストラクト？！
2人で遊ぶゲームです。
４×４の盤に手持ちのスシを盤に配置したり、移動させたりして、相手の玉を囲えば勝利です。
マグロ・タコ・エビのネタチップをシャリチップ（1つはサビ入り）に重ね、スシを作ります（これは1つのコマになります）。
他に玉・カッパ・テッカがあり、1人計6個のスシをもち勝負します。
ピンチの時は相手のスシをゲーム中1回だけ食べられます。
食べられたスシはゲームから取り除かれます。
ただし、それがサビ入りなら食べた人は即敗北してしまいます。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Generic Dungeon Generator (T&T)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

To design your random dungeon, follow the tables below.

User summary:

A simple process and series of random tables to generate a random dungeon; adapted for Tunnels & Trolls.

boardgame.name: Down the Rabbit Hole
boardgame.description: You are about to enter Wonderland. This VR adventure will take you down the rabbit hole to experience a magical world like it has never been experienced
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 D.I.C.E. Best Immersive Reality Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Museum of Other Realities
boardgame.description: The Museum of Other Realities (MOR) is an immersive multiplayer art showcase in VR.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 D.I.C.E. Best Immersive Reality Technical Achievement of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Hearts of Iron 4: Man the Guns
Hearts of Iron IV: Man the Guns
boardgame.description:
Control the Seas

From the convoy attacks in the Battle of the Atlantic to the fierce carrier battles on the Pacific front, the Second World War saw naval innovation in both tactics and technology. The war at sea takes center stage in Hearts of Iron IV: Man the Guns, a new expansion to Paradox Development Studio’s popular strategy wargame.

Design your own ships and refit older models. Alter your convoy routes to avoid hungry wolf packs. Embrace or circumvent naval treaties and deal with the diplomatic consequences.

Man the Guns also introduces new alternate history paths for the major democracies of the war and gives the freedom loving nations of the world more freedom to act before the war forces their hand.
Main Features
New Alternate American History
Use the American Congress to push for reform, at the risk of plunging the nation into another civil war.

New Alternate British History
Push for early decolonization of the British Empire or restore the ancient privileges of the monarchy.

Ship Design
Research new components and refit older vessels to take advantage of new knowledge. Outfit your submarines with snorkels or improved stealth.

Admiral Traits and Skills
Tailor and level up your Admirals with new traits and skills.

Governments in Exile
Welcome a government in exile to your democracy, boosting their legitimacy in return for more manpower and elite troops fighting to free their homeland.

Other National Focuses
New national focuses for The Netherlands and Mexico.

Naval Mines
Protect your coasts from invasion or assault with anti-ship mines, or clear a path through enemy mines before you make the big push.

Shipping route controls
Plot new routes for your shipping and navies by marking areas you want to avoid.

Naval Treaties
Struggle to keep the peace by following internationally agreed upon rules, or creatively defy the world consensus by exceeding your limits.

Amphibious Landing Vehicles
Add power to your beach landing by researching and producing specialized combat vehicles for your marines.

New Music
Original music composed specifically for the Man the Guns expansion.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Stadt Land Unseriös: XMAS-Special
boardgame.description:
XMAS-Special of Take It Serious Stadt Land Unseriös with 72 different and innovative categories for great christmas time.

--

Das XMAS-Special von Take It Serious Stadt Land Unseriös mit 72 unterschiedlichen, innovativen und weihnachtlichen Kategorien für eine großartige Weihnachts- und Adventszeit.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Take It Serious: Stadt Land Unseriös

boardgame.name: Last Stand at Mistham: A Campaign for Sellsords and Spellslingers
boardgame.description:
Goblins, orcs and ogres surround you.

Last Stand at Mistham is a simple, goblin-and-orc smashing campaign for the Sellswords and Spellslingers solo/coop fantasy miniatures rules.
Your heroes are tasked with stopping goblin attacks on Mistham, a peaceful village. A run of the mill job for seasoned heroes… but when the two daughters of the village chief are involved, the situation quickly becomes much more complicated.

Contents:

Five Scenarios for 1-6 players, each running a party of adventurers built on 60 to 150 points,
42 pages


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – Borg Sphere Starter Set
boardgame.description:
Based on the Star Trek TNG First Contact movie. Five Rings Publishing Group released the game in a Federation and Borg starter pack.

This is the Borg Sphere Starter Set
Resistance is futile. This set enables you to command the Borg Sphere and assimilate all you encounter.
25 assorted 20mm polyhedral dice; three 6-sided, five 8-sided, six 10-sided, seven 12-sided and four 20-sided dice
The dice control your ship's warp core, reserve power, shield strength, phasers, quantum torpedos, damage control, impulse power and sensors
A full-color ship Bridge/control panel from which you command ship systems and personnel
A full color ship shield and icon chart, and a 24 page Basic Training(TM) instruction book and rules.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – Borg Sphere Booster Set #2
Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game

boardgame.name: El Ñandú
boardgame.description:
El Ñandú ("The Rhea") is a competitive game, where each player represents a rhea (a kind of bird) in search of on food.
It’s a game of negotiation and speed. Each player starts with 8 cards and in one turn
Simultaneous, in real time, players must exchange their cards among themselves and collect 8 of a certain type to win, or failing that, realize when to stop, not to lose.
Multiple rounds will be played until at least one of the following rounds is fulfilled

Conditions:
Whoever manages to win 5 rounds will be called the fastest Rhea and thus win the game.
Or whoever comes last in 5 rounds will be called the slowest Rhea,
losing and ending like that, the game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Invasion
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Invasion is a game for Odyssey. The troops is placed and moved on an actual game board (like a real board game), but the fight is done on screen with the video game, in a game that reminds a bit of Pong.

boardgame.name: 上海蒼龍-チャイニーズ人狼- (Shanghai Blue Dragon - Chinese Werewolf -)
boardgame.description:
上海蒼龍チャイニーズ人狼 (Shanghai Blue Dragon - Chinese Werewolf -) is a werewolf game from Japan.

A game based on the original werewolf game Mafia.

The game is set in the 1920's in the Shanghai concession, and the battle between the mafia and the police has been incorporated into the world of wargames. The players are divided into three camps: mafia, citizens and outlaws. The game is played in the same way as a regular werewolf game, but with the added bonus of having a weapon of choice for each position. In addition, the game progresses faster because there are players in all camps with the ability to kill. It is a werewolf game with 'half the time, twice the deduction'.

人狼の元である「マフィア」をアレンジしたゲームです。
舞台は1920年代の上海租界。
暗躍するマフィアたちと警察の戦いを、人狼ゲームの世界に落とし込みました。
プレイヤーはマフィア・市民・アウトローの３陣営に分かれて戦います。進行は普通の人狼と同じですが、全役職が陣営の他に武器の有無というパラメーターを持つため深い推理が必要です。また、殺害能力を持つ役職が全陣営にいるため進行も早くなります。
まさに「時間は半分、推理は２倍」の人狼です。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Mayhem-Museum
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Ander-Whyles Museum -its erudite veneer done-up in the Greek-Revival motif- hides a panoply of Victorian Era war-spoils and early-century cultural flare. Here, there are dust-shrouded mummies, the ossein relics of Jurassic colossals, the cold-tempered plating of medieval champions, and a congregation of wax mannequins frozen in historic discourse. Do you feel it? There’s a sort of ancient magic that hangs about the place. It’s the sort of thing that calls youngsters off to great adventure!

"Mayhem-Museum" is our second Triple-Dog-Dare, offering 3 adventures for the Dare-Luck Club Role-Playing Game. The anthology starts with “When the Dead Walk, the Living Should Run!” where the acquisition of a strange meteorite draws the Dare-Luckers into a battle against the walking dead. Next, we submit to you “Curse of the Ander-Whiles Museum.” The kids’ antics at the museum have angered a very peculiar patron -with a mystic utterance they find themselves in a shadowy version of the museum -where the exhibits are ready to make THEM history! Wrapping up the trilogy, the kids become unlikely cat burglars as they try to pull a museum caper in an attempt to make things right with an orphanage in danger of closing. Can they defeat the security, outsmart guards, and make off with the goods? Find out in, “Of Heist and Hijinks.”

Buy your tickets in advance, and save some change for the giftshop -this omnibus is an “exhibit” of historic proportions!
boardgame.rpgitemversion: North Texas RPG Con PDF Preview Edition

boardgame.name: Everdell: Pearlbrook – Pearls Upgrade Pack
boardgame.description: Exchange your plastic pearls from the retail copy of Everdell: Pearlbrook expansion for these luxurious glass pearls! Already contained in the Pearlbrook Collector's Edition.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Everdell: Pearlbrook

boardgame.name: Navio Pirata
boardgame.description:
In Navio Pirata ("Pirate Ship"), the player must go through the islands of the board to collect cards and exchange them for the cards that will form the "pirate ship". The winner will be whoever manages to collect the 6 cards first and form his pirate ship.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – Kainan's Reapers
boardgame.description:
When Nagash resolved to conquer Ghur, Kainan's Reapers were amongst the first forces he despatched, the tithekeepers sent to call in ancient debts and claim osseous stockpiles that might be used to bolster the Bonereapers' advance. The Mortisan Executioner Mir Kainan was charged with collecting the long-overdue tithe of the Silent People. When they arrived in Beastgrave, Kainan's Reapers found the Silent People had fled, their regular migration cycle interrupted by the mountain's anguished raging. They did not intend to return empty-handed, however. Direchasm's depths held countless ancient bones, and many rival warbands would pay the price for the Silent People's delinquency.

Bringing hitting power, magic, and disposable bone constructs to the living mountain, Kainan's Reapers are an incredibly flexible warband. Emphasise your preferred play style through the use of a range of warband-specific and universal cards, and their new tithe mechanic will help you inspire your warband. This set also features universal cards for any warband in Warhammer Underworlds, while a free downloadable warscroll lets you fight with Kainan's Reapers in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This set contains:

6x push-fit Kainan's Reapers miniatures – no glue required to assemble
6x fighter cards, representing each warrior in your games – Kainan, Karu, Nohem, Senha, Hakor, and Binar Khenta
A further 62 playable cards (only available in this set) to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm, including:
12x Kainan's Reapers objective cards
10x Kainan's Reapers upgrade cards
10x Kainan's Reapers ploy cards
10x Universal objective cards, usable by any warband
10x Universal upgrade cards, usable by any warband
7x Universal gambit cards, usable by any warband
3x Universal gambit spell cards, usable by any wizard

listing.notes: New, never opened! Box has light storage wear.

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Bestiary 3 Pawn Collection
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Complete the triple threat of monster pawns! The Pathfinder Bestiary 3 Pawn Collection collects the monsters found in Pathfinder Bestiary 3 and are perfect for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any fantasy RPG. This collection presents beautiful full-color images of a wide array of new nasties, including more than 300 monsters such as dragons, clockworks, demons, devils, hags, kami, ouroboros, sprites, titans, valkyries, and more!

Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from the Pathfinder Pawns Base Assortment, making them easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. The Pathfinder Bestiary 3 Pawn Collection is the best way to ensure you've got the perfect monster for every Pathfinder Roleplaying Game encounter!

boardgame.name: The Ninja Mission Conundrum
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Året är 1984 och ni är mitt i produktionen av “mästerverket” “The Ninja Mission Cunundrum”, en lågbudgetfilm med stora ambitioner. För stora ambitioner. Det här kunde ha varit vägen från ett litet filmbolag i djupaste Småland till en storproduktion i självaste Hollywood. Ni är kämpande skådespelare, producenter, manusförfattare och kanske till och med regissören själv är med. Allt skulle kunnat gått bra om det inte vore för att producenten lånat pengar av fel killar och spelat bort hela budgeten på travet, regissören har en affär med den kvinnliga huvudrollsskådespelaren, och stuntmännen bojkottar inspelningen för att det tas för stora risker och skådespelarna får göra sina egna stunts. Listan kan göras lång. Allt är på väg att falla sönder och alla greppar girigt efter sin del av det lilla som finns kvar innan allt rasar samman. Alla skyller på alla och ingen tar på sig ansvaret för ett av Sveriges största filmfiaskon.

boardgame.name: Love Sinks
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb
Love Sinks is a solo roleplaying game using the Wretched & Alone game system. If you have played other Wretched & Alone games, this will be a similar experience.

You play as a contestant on the reality dating show, Love Sinks. On this show you are competing to marry the youngest of the Atlantean royal family. You will compete against other contestants and watch one by one as they are eliminated. Will you find true love before you are eliminated?

Love Sinks is about how we are changed by the relationships we are in and what is lost in the process.

boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Conflicts of the Heian period – Japan

boardgame.name: Grimdark Future: Arena – Season 1
boardgame.description:
Grimdark Future: Arena is a hex-combat miniatures game set in a war-torn sci-fi future, which is played using 28mm miniatures.
The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging sci-fi duels for new and experienced players alike.

This is a fast-paced combat game played on a hex-board with 3-7 models per side, featuring customizable warbands and special strategies and objectives.
The game also comes with rules for how to play without a hex-board, requiring no printing at all if you prefer.

The printable paper miniatures are formated for easy printing, cutting and folding, and they come with 1 color scheme, as well as with a black border version of all miniatures.

—description from the publisher

The main cardholder is a modular layout with 2 variable walls, 4 big dividers and 4 small dividers (another grace of the design, that 2 dividers can be set right next to each other with the smart solution of the puzzle-like tabs)

boardgame.name: A Giant Shield
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

You've been hired to escort and guard a wealthy merchant into the Black Yew forest to obtain some of the wood that the forest is famous for. Should be a simple job. . . right?

boardgame.name: Energiekonferenz
boardgame.description:
Energy Conference is an environmental quiz game. In a semicircle you move your wooden figure from one field to the next. The distance is 18 fields. To move one field further, you have to answer a randomly selected question about the field topic correctly. These questions are summarized for each of four topics on a card and color-coded. In the case of difficult fields, you can call an energy conference with all players already present on the field in order to get to the bottom of the next three questions together or in competition with each other. If you are totally stuck, you can use a joker card, but it can only be used twice per player.

—user summary
